intro: Meyerafra, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, thick leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, white, and red, making it a popular ornamental plant. Meyerafra thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
